Try this delicious MAGGI Noodle Burger Recipe

MAGGI Noodle Burger Recipe 
Serves: 2
Time: 20 Minutes 
Ingredients 
1 Packet MAGGI Daiya Cheese Noodles 
1 Egg
50ml Milk 
For the Vegetable Patty : 
30g Carrot 
20g Beans 
¬Ω tsp Chili Flakes 
2 Green chilies
Salt & Pepper to taste 
40g Potatoes 
10g Chopped Onions 
5g Garlic 
For the Chicken Patty: 
300g Minced Chicken Breast 
¬Ω tsp Chili Flakes 
10g Chopped Onions 
5g Garlic 
Salt & Pepper to taste 
2 Green chillies
Method: 
1.Soak the noodles in water, strain and keep aside 
2.To the soaked noodles, add the MAGGI tastemaker, milk, an egg, pepper and mix well. 
3.Mould the noodle mixture to a circular shape and grill on low fire till golden brown, make two for one burger.
4.To make a vegetable patty, add oil to the pan and add beans, carrots, potatoes, ginger & garlic and spices and mix well until everything is cooked. Grill this patty till golden and set aside. 
5.To make a chicken patty, add the minced chicken to a bowl along with salt & pepper to taste and mix well. Grill this patty till golden and set aside. 
6.Assemble the noodle burger with the patty of your choice. ‚ù§Ô∏è An amazing new twist to have this Christmas! Try this delicious MAGGI Noodle Burger Recipe

Credit- Newsflare My name is Pavithra. I think many people know me, no matter when our paths have crossed. Maybe some like me, and others don't, but if you are on my Facebook, I want to believe that you like me. I would love to see if we can still communicate with more than just likes and gifs, and actually write something to each other. I decided to participate in an experience called "A Meeting Between Breadfruit". The idea is to see who reads a post without a photo. We are so immersed in technology that we have forgotten the most important thing: good friendship. If no one reads this message, it will be a short social experiment. But if you read it until the end, I want you to make a comment with one word about us. For example, a place, an object, a person, a moment with which you relate or remember me by. Then copy this text and stick it on your wall, (don't share) and I'll go to your wall to leave a word that reminds me of you. Please don't write any comments if you don't have time to copy the text. That would ruin the experiment.
Change my name and write yours. Let's see who took time to read and answer according to the shared story beyond Facebook!! She melts my heart EVERY time!‚ù§Ô∏èÔ∏è

(‡∂ã‡∂¥‡∑î‡∂ß‡∑è ‡∂ú‡∑ê‡∂±‡∑í‡∂∏‡∂ö‡∑ä ) My name is Pavithra. I think many people know me, no matter when our paths have crossed. Maybe some like me, and others don't, but if you are on my Facebook, I want to believe that you like me. I would love to see if we can still communicate with more than just likes and gifs, and actually write something to each other. I decided to participate in an experience called "A Meeting Between Breadfruit". The idea is to see who reads a post without a photo. We are so immersed in technology that we have forgotten the most important thing: good friendship. If no one reads this message, it will be a short social experiment. But if you read it until the end, I want you to make a comment with one word about us. For example, a place, an object, a person, a moment with which you relate or remember me by. Then copy this text and stick it on your wall, (don't share) and I'll go to your wall to leave a word that reminds me of you. Please don't write any comments if you don't have time to copy the text. That would ruin the experiment.
Change my name and write yours. Let's see who took time to read and answer according to the shared story beyond Facebook!! ‡∂¢‡∑ì‡∑Ä‡∑í‡∂≠‡∂∫ ‡∂±‡∂∏‡∑ä ‡∂∏‡∑ô‡∂∫‡∂∫‡∑í ....

https://www.instagram.com/hausercello But you're just a boy... ‚ÄúIn 2015, my wife and I were saving up to go on a peaceful and ‚Äòjust us‚Äô holiday to Australia ... little did we know that our fund was going to soon be eaten, and I mean literally eaten by our unexpected arrivals! We were in the 3rd month of our pregnancy when we first realized my wife was pregnant. The surprises didn‚Äôt stop there -- our first sonography showed that we were expecting not one, but two kids -- you can only imagine the sheer terrifying excitement!
I planned on staying at home while my wife went back to work, it was an obvious decision for  us simply because she earned more and we now had an army to feed. When I first told my dad about my decision of staying at home, he only asked me once if I was sure -- when I said yes, he never asked me again. 
It was harder for people outside of the family to understand -- questions like ‚ÄòLahar, are you going to be comfortable asking your wife for money?‚Äô or ‚ÄòAre you really going to be at home while your wife is at work?‚Äô or ‚ÄòAre you really going to do housework?‚Äô were thrown my way. Obviously, she was my wife‚Ä¶ I wasn‚Äôt working, so who else would I ask? I was always good at responding to these questions with the obvious truth. 
Thing is, my wife carried them for 9 months, she has this unique bond with them that no one in the world will ever have. So it‚Äôs only fair that I bond with them too! But kids keep you always moving on your feet, and with two of them, I was running... Eat, poop, sleep became our mantra!
Like most kids, mine slept for about 18 hours at various intervals, but I had two who were never in sync and on their own schedules -- so I was at a new level of sleep deprivation. My sense of depth was completely out of whack -- I cannot tell you the number of times I have walked into something that was right in front of me and stubbed the crap out of my toes!   
I remember our feeding schedule -- post-its stuck on the wall after either of us fed a kid, just so we could keep track. Obviously, there have been multiple times where one of us has fed one kid, forgotten to update our post-it wall, and the same kid has been fed again leaving the other one hungry‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs a running joke between my wife and I that we don‚Äôt remember the months of March and April 2016‚Ä¶ Our memories of those two months are all just a blur with these two rascals. 
But nothing will be more special than that time I had with them -- the diaper changes, the all-nighters, the crying fests -- that time is irreplaceable. Surprisingly, when one year down the line, I decided to go back to work, the transition was smooth. My wife and I both work now, and raise our kids together. It‚Äôs always family first for us -- how does it matter who‚Äôs the one providing and who‚Äôs staying at home? "We thought we were having fun, didn't know we were making Memories" üòç When your life changes or goes through a certain phase, your friendships will, too. It's that simple.

I used to have a lot of drama around this. I‚Äôd feel guilty and hurt and get stuck in a spiral of wondering what I did wrong. Until I learned the simple truth that it‚Äôs not personal, it‚Äôs just a pattern.

Authentic friendship is not about drama or obligation. Real friends help each other grow. They are supportive. They stay present and they make time to see each other... and when there isn't time, they don't make you feel guilty.

Watch this to see how you can shed the guilt and make room for the people that are meant to be in your life -- right now and hopefully for a very long time. "We thought we were having fun, didn't know we were making Memories" üòç ‚ÄúGrowing up, I was always called names like ‚Äòbaby elephant‚Äô and ‚Äòmotu‚Äô. But, back then, I was too naive to get offended by these tags. I was happy with how I looked and my body never came in the way of anything I did -- whether it was learning Indian classical dance or playing lawn tennis at the district level. 
It was only in my teens that I realized the amount of importance that people place on the way someone looks. I remember one of my friends showing me a guy‚Äôs photo saying, ‚ÄòI have a huge crush on him, what do you think about him?‚Äô I was surprised at how she was judging this guy, whom she had never met before, on only his looks! But I didn‚Äôt let things like this change the way I felt about myself. 
The only time I felt bad was when I couldn‚Äôt get trendy clothes in my size. So, I fixed that problem the only way I knew how, on my own! I would buy material from the market and design things I loved to wear. It was the perfect solution because it allowed me to be unique and creative and it also introduced me to the fashion designing world. But never in my wildest dreams did I ever think I would be a model. 
I was always frustrated by how people who didn‚Äôt fit the generic standards of beauty were looked down upon. I wanted to do something that broke those stereotypes; when one day, I saw an audition call for plus size models. This was finally my chance to help alter the way society perceives people like me. 
It was such an amazing feeling when I was selected to walk the ramp at the Lakme Fashion Week! It even gave me the chance to interact with people who‚Äôd been through similar struggles in their lives. I was motivated to continue fighting the battle against the devil called ‚Äòbody shaming‚Äô. 
In 2016, I started my online blog which focused on body positivity and how to accept yourself the way you are. Through my blog, I‚Äôve interacted with so many young boys and girls who suffer from an inferiority complex because of the size of their bodies.
I will never forget one of the first messages I got from a young girl -- ‚ÄòToday, I wore a sleeveless dress for the first time in my life, and it felt so great. I have stopped caring about what other people think about me and have decided to live my life the way I want to.‚Äô
Looking back, I wish I had started my blogging journey earlier on. But to be fair, back then, there was no one to guide me, or inspire me, or even motivate me. So, if I can be that person for someone else in today‚Äôs world, then I would consider myself to be very lucky! I don't like you one bit. No, not at all. It is because of you that I looked for my Raj during every train ride and each journey turned into a major disappointment as the only ones that I met were coughing uncles and crying infants.
It is because of you that I, a woman in her 20s still cries like a baby while watching Kal Ho Na Ho for the 50th time. I‚Äôm not embarrassed to be honest.
It is because of you that friendship bands became cool and countless nights were spent wishing upon shooting stars. It‚Äôs you who made me believe that if Veer could spend 22 years in jail for Zara, my crush could at least text me back.

See, I am not a teen anymore. I know things in life don't happen by wishing upon stars. I know that boys and girls can be just friends, and that pyaar isn't always dosti. I know that love doesn't always arrive, while playing mandolin in the background. It is much quieter, much simpler. I know that you cannot dance in sleeveless blouses and chiffon sarees on snow-capped mountains, if you wish to come back alive. I know that not every father lets his daughter get on the train.

Yet, I also find myself reciting your dialogues in tough times, overcoming my failures by mumbling, ‚ÄúHaar ke jeetne waale ko baazigar kehte hai.‚Äù
And somewhere, deep down in my heart, I still call out to my lovers inwardly chanting, "Palat, Palat!‚Äù
I know that no one will turn, I know that a dialogue won‚Äôt change my defeats into victories. But in that moment, that faith is all I need.

Thank you SRK, for the dreams, the ever open arms, and for single-handedly giving birth to unrealistic expectations of romance.
And I know that if a man can make a crowd of thousands cry every time he sheds a tear on screen, he'll always hold the power to make us believe in love and a lot more. For even the best of the cynics, will always need a little bit of magic. Happy 27 years Shah - here's hoping 27 more.

~Shruti Sonal

"Why did Peter Pan, chose Wendy instead of Tinkerbell?" 

"He didn't chose Wendy, it's his heart who chose her."

"Did they live happily ever after?"

"No."

"Why? I thought they love each other."

"Yes, they did love each other, but it doesn't mean that they'll end up together and they'll live happily ever after."

"Why? What happened?"

"Wendy chose to leave Neverland, she chose her family than to live with Peter. He let her go and even accompanied her to their house."

"What happened next?"

"Before Peter Pan went back to Neverland, Wendy asked her if will he come back and Peter said yes 'cause he wants to hear her stories about him and the pirates. After that, he went back to Neverland with Tinkerbell."

"But Peter Pan didn't come back to Wendy's house right?"

"Yes, that's the saddest part of their story. Wendy waited for him but he didn't show up anymore even just his shadow. Wendy grew up and got married. She's still telling the tale of Peter Pan and Captain Hook to her children and her grandchildren, still waiting for him to show up."

"In that case, did Peter Pan chose Tinkerbell instead?"

"No, he chose Neverland, he chose his home, but his heart will always be Wendy's."

"Oh, so both of them can't sacrifice in order to be together? Wendy can't leave her family, while Peter can't leave Neverland, so they chose to just part ways."

"Exactly."

"What happened to Tinkerbell?"

"She remained friends with Peter Pan though she loves him romantically."

"So the three characters end up miserable."

"Why?"

"cause they were not chosen by their loved ones."

"Funny how fate played them." üíî

‚ÄúThe NBA family is devastated by the tragic passing of Kobe Bryant and his daughter, Gianna. 

‚ÄúFor 20 seasons, Kobe showed us what is possible when remarkable talent blends with an absolute devotion to winning.  He was one of the most extraordinary players in the history of our game with accomplishments that are legendary:  five NBA championships, an NBA MVP award, 18 NBA All-Star selections, and two Olympic gold medals.  But he will be remembered most for inspiring people around the world to pick up a basketball and compete to the very best of their ability.  He was generous with the wisdom he acquired and saw it as his mission to share it with future generations of players, taking special delight in passing down his love of the game to Gianna.

Based on screenplay & Characters : @Marvel Studios ‚ù§Ô∏è Me talking to my grandchildren in 2060:

This man right here is the definition of "obsession for perfection".

This man never gave up. His fiercest rival won the fourth consecutive Ballon d'Or in 2012 and everyone claimed that it was the end of all the discussion. There was no way Ronaldo could even catch up to that tally let alone surpassing it. His national side was in shambles and Real Madrid were celebrating the victory of Copa Del Rey as a successful season.

What do you think happened then? 
Did Cristiano Ronaldo gave up and said that I've already won everything with one club and have the individual trophies also to be considered as one of the elite players? 

No my child, Cristiano Ronaldo struggled harder, he produced the moments of magic, he started to change his game once again to play more effective football and not eye pleasing football. He overtook Messi's Ballon d'Or tally and made it 6-5 in 2018, a comeback from 4-1.

He won Euro 2016 with Portugal by scoring 3 and assisting 3 in the campaign where Portugal scored only 9 goals. 

The man who joined a struggling Manchester United and took it to glory, later joined a struggling Real Madrid who were about to see the fate of AC Milan and took them to the glory of 4 UCL titles in 5 years.

He took his side to World Cup 2014 by scoring a hat-trick against Zlatan's Sweden but was unfortunate to play in the World Cup with tendinitis but still featured on the pitch after taking painkillers. He still did not give up. 

He entered the 2018 World Cup with more ambition than anyone else and scored a hat-trick against the greatest side in the tournament, Spain. He kept on believing. He never gave up. In the tunnel you could see him clapping ferociously and shouting encouraging words such as 'Vamos', on the pitch, he was seen patting the goalkeeper Rui Patricio for his contribution, he was seen as a true leader and the whole Portugal side was radiating the feeling of being secure and confident to have Cristiano Ronaldo on their side. 

All the pundits and football experts started to agree with your grandfather's view that indeed Cristiano Ronaldo is the special player who will be remembered as a true sportsman and a leader than just another legendary football player. 

Some sportsmen such as Mohammed Ali are more than one particular sport. They represent a lot more, and that is what Cristiano Ronaldo had achieved. Today we recall Messi as a great footballer. But we recall Cristiano Ronaldo as more than a footballer. The person people want to be like. The mothers who name their children after him. The person who always stood up when all hopes died. The person who will remain there in books for centuries like Achilles or Alexander. 

"I lived in the era of Cristiano Ronaldo and watched him grace the game live."

Heavenly lands of  University of Peradeniya that is set among rolling mountains and leafy woodlands that spans nearly about 700 hectares in the Mahavali flood plain bears stunning surroundings that doesn't stand second to it's outstanding academic credentials. The most anticipated season of the year is arrived when the flowers bloom perfuming the air with their heavenly scent spreading the message of love and harmony.The lush yellow color under the blue sky is breathtaking and does not fail to make memories that last for a lifetime. The heavenly aromas and this breathtaking sceneries is an evocative of summers past and a teleporter to the memories that we cherish despite the age and all the differences. We are inarguably the luckiest to witness this beauty.

To stay competitive in today's market, organizations need to employ innovation in their product design landscape. Usability and User experience is one such avenue. This meetup includes tech talks and a panel discussion around how Sri Lankan organizations can accelerate their innovative product design aspect.

Product Design: Accelerating the Innovation will take place on the 25th of September, at Dialog Axiata Auditorium.

Register here: bit.ly/techtalkux

She marked her humble beginning as a parish school at the heart of the great city of Colombo,with 24 students and 4 members of staff with the only facility provided by St.Paul's Church ,a small mud hut.

She overcame many obstacles and challenges which came across her journey towards the excellence, becoming of famed leading girls' school.

She has proven the foremost teaching of her,the motto of school,"Per Aspera Ad Astra"-which guides the little lilies to reach the stars through the clouds by herself. Now she is providing the shade of love,caring and sisterhood to over 4500 students without any biases based on class,caste or creed.

Today is her 133rd birthday.

Congratulations Kavinda Senarathne ‚úåÔ∏èüòç "The Rotaract Club of Alumni of University of Moratuwa proudly introduces Rtr. Sanira Wickramaarachchi,  and Rtr. Kavinda Senarathne, the Joint Directors of Community Services for the Rotaract year 2019/20. 

Rtr. Sanira Wickramaarachchi was a part of many projects including Hand in Hand 2015, Sojourn 2015, Healing Hands 2016, Sparkle 2016, Intellect 2016, and Akurata Aruthak 2017 throughout his years as a Rotaractor. He was the co-chairperson of the Educational subproject of Grama Prabodaya 2017/18 which led the students of Ranugalla Junior School to gain 100% pass percentage from the Ordinary Level Examination in 2018. Rtr. Kavinda Senarathne is a young energetic Rotaractor who worked hard in several phases of the Hand in Hand project, and he also contributed actively to make the Are You Ready series a success.

The enthusiasm and passion they share towards the Rotaract movement have encouraged many to enjoy team-working. Their leadership skills and friendliness with fellow Rotaractors create beautiful bonds that lend a helping hand.

We wish them the best of luck for the coming year to continue their service to the community as Rotaractors while striving to save the earth.

‚ÄúI will not kill or hurt any living creature needlessly, nor destroy any beautiful thing, but will strive to save and comfort all gentle life, and guard and perfect all natural beauty upon the earth.‚Äù
‚Äî John Ruskin"
